summary: Building Nigeria's first professional retail certification system using mobile micro-lessons, monthly in-store role-plays and bi-annual external assessments. Goal: measurable uplift in frontline sales KPIs while creating clear career pathways for retail staff.

decisions.decision: Pilot partner remains open; LBS proposal optional but not blocking.
decisions.reason: Allows faster testing while proposal is pending.

decisions.decision: Rebuild landing page; Netlify prototype is legacy.
decisions.reason: Need clearer messaging for pilot recruitment.
Based on Abu interview numbers (65 managers, 275 staff).

decisions.decision: Treat sales-training-archive-v002.zip as draft; final asset pack to be produced.

considerations.text: Certification scope: internal-only (retention) vs industry-transferable (talent marketplace).
Primary KPI: conversion rate vs basket size vs basket items; may vary by retailer.
Incentive model – bond or pay-band progression tied to certification levels.
Manager bias & capability; need robust external checks & AI-assisted grading.

cross_project_insights.insight: Mobile micro-lesson framework reusable for hospitality vertical.

conflicts.details: Managers limited to ~2 h/month for assessments; risks under-scoring external component.
Transferable certificates may increase staff churn; owners express concern.

side_discoveries.note: Retail Routine App – hourly push-nudge with QR feedback proposed by Abu.
QR customer feedback tool complements KPI tracking.
